talk.author: did:plc:sa3qiun2ccmqqqlooxcsyxkq
talk.utter: It won’t, except by changing the law.

talk.author: did:plc:2qsizws3cqz2jdnn5prfs5r6
talk.utter: Do you believe that no one fought for equality UNTIL laws changed?

talk.author: did:plc:sa3qiun2ccmqqqlooxcsyxkq
talk.utter:
I wrote what I wrote.
Read it.

talk.author: did:plc:sa3qiun2ccmqqqlooxcsyxkq
talk.utter:
You’ve fallen far, Tom.
The proponents of calling Israel’s policy toward the Palestinians “genocidal” (ie, tending “toward” or “to have the effect”) have a good case in international law, although I very much doubt any Israeli could be convicted of genocide or even wholesale war crimes.
1/

talk.author: did:plc:sqrfvc3whmkz5btcmapky63d
talk.utter: Tell Tom to “do better”, he always loves that ☺️

talk.author: did:plc:sa3qiun2ccmqqqlooxcsyxkq
talk.utter: Where did I do that? I want him to know that as someone who’s read both his books of expertise (nuke policy) and punditry (education policy) I’ve lost some respect for him over this comment, and why.

talk.author: did:plc:sa3qiun2ccmqqqlooxcsyxkq

talk.author: did:plc:sqrfvc3whmkz5btcmapky63d
